titleStmt.title: A rod for the fools back: or, an answer to a scurrilous libel, called The changeling.

notesStmt.note: A reply to Robert Wild's "The recantation of a penitent proteus or The changeling" (Wing 35251), which satirized Richard Lee who adhered to the Parliament until 1663 when he recanted his anti-royalist opinions in his 'Cor Humiliatum et contritum'(Wing L888).
Verse: "Ye learned doctors of th' Smectymnian Creed, (bleed ..."
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
